name: Try To Remember "The Fantasticks" Quiz | Humanities | 15 Questions

questions.text: Matt and Luisa are two young people who are madly in love. What stops them from being married?
questions.correct: Their parents don't like each other
options: They live miles away from each other
questions.explanation:
Their parents don't like each other.

	The fathers, Hucklebee and Bellomy, are actually best friends. They pretend to feud only to get the younger couple to fall in love.

questions.text: According to Luisa, which color did her hair turn as she was brushing it?
questions.explanation:
Mauve.

	Of course this didn't actually happen, but Luisa says many things throughout the show that makes her sanity questionable. But doesn't love make fools of us all?

options: She and Matt were actually related
She and Matt never met again
questions.explanation:
She was abducted by bandits.

	Oddly enough, her dream comes true later in Act One, when El Gallo, Henry and Mortimer attempt to kidnap her.

questions.text: The parents are pleased because Matt and Luisa are obviously in love. How do they choose to end their fake feud?
questions.correct: Stage an abduction where Matt saves Luisa
options: Stage an abduction where Luisa saves Matt
questions.explanation:
Stage an abduction where Matt saves Luisa.

	Hucklebee and Bellomy decide to end the feud in grand style, hiring El Gallo to fake an elaborate kidnapping and allowing Matt to save her. El Gallo sings about the various kinds of kidnappings he can pull off in the song "It Depends on What You Pay".

questions.text: El Gallo enlists the help of two old actors: Henry and Mortimer. Henry is an old Shakespearean actor and Mortime specializes in faking his death in gory ways. What is Henry's last name?
questions.explanation:
Albertson.

	"I'm Henry Albertson. Perhaps you recall my Hamlet?" says Henry as he introduces himself to El Gallo towards the end of Act One. Later in Act Two Henry and Mortimer kidnap Matt and savagely beat him.

questions.text: In the opening number of Act Two, what does Matt request of Luisa?
questions.correct: To not watch him while he's eating
options: To stop putting too much makeup on
To put a ribbon in her hair
questions.explanation:
To not watch him while he's eating.

	In "This Plum Is Too Ripe", Matt, Luisa, Hucklebee and Bellomy realize that their utopian lifestyle may not be exactly all it is cracked up to be. Luisa comments that Matt looks different in the sunlight, while the fathers invade each other's gardens.

questions.text: Which duo sings "I Can See It"?
questions.explanation:
Matt and El Gallo.

	"I Can See It" is a duet between Matt and El Gallo. Matt sings of the idealized world he is setting out to see and El Gallo counters him, singing about the world he'll encounter.

questions.text: While Matt is away, El Gallo seduces Luisa. While telling her about his adventures as a bandit, he brings up horseriding. Why did he eventually stop riding a horse?
questions.explanation:
Because he got saddle rash.

	El Gallo forsook horses when he got a very painful case of saddle rash. This exchange occurs shortly before the waltz "Round and Round".

questions.text: During the song "Round and Round", which of these painful situations is Matt NOT subjected to?
options: Being made to lie on a bed of nails
questions.explanation:
Being whipped.

	As El Gallo and Luisa sing about a beautiful world, Henry and Mortimer abuse Matt in a myriad of painful ways. Luckily, Matt survives all this, but is much the worse for wear.

questions.text: At the end of the show everyone is living happily ever after after becoming a little wiser in the process. What does El Gallo tell the parents to do?
questions.correct: Leave up the wall between Matt and Luisa's house
options: Let Matt and Luisa move away
Allow Matt and Luisa to marry
questions.explanation:
Leave up the wall between Matt and Luisa's house.

	"You must always leave the wall." El Gallo proclaims as he sings a reprise of "Try to Remember". He hangs up a banner, signalling the end of the show.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "Metaphor": "My __________ of love."
questions.explanation:
Mystery.

	"Metaphor" is a love song sung by Matt and Luisa in Act One.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "It Depends on What You Pay": "We've the obvious, open schoolboy __________"
questions.explanation:
Rape.

	El Gallo insists on using the word "rape" in place of "abduction" or "kidnapping". Technically, he's right to use the word, for "rape" did not originally seem synonymous with sexual intercourse. El Gallo uses it in its original meaning: to kidnap. (This has caused some controversy, and alternate lyrics were written by the authors in the 1990's.)

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "Soon It's Gonna Rain": "Smell how the _________ rain is falling."
questions.explanation:
Velvet.

	"Soon It's Gonna Rain" is a love duet between Matt and Luisa, where they describe their future life together. They'll "live and love within [their] own four walls."

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "I Can See It": "Bright lights somewhere invite me to come there and ________"
questions.explanation:
Learn.

	Matt fights with Luisa and leaves. He sings about the exciting new life he's about the live while El Gallo lurks in the background, cynically offering his own opinion.

questions.text: Complete this lyrics from "Round and Round": "I seem to see ________, it's terribly chic."
questions.explanation:
Athens.

	In "Round and Round", El Gallo and Luisa take a whirlwind tour of the world, stopping in Athens, India and Venice. As the duo sing, Henry and Mortimer physically torture Matt.
